New Records: Cape Verde won an Africa Cup of Nations knockout tie for the first time in their history.
Key Match Events: Ryan Mendes scored a late penalty to give Cape Verde a 1-0 victory over Mauritania.
Cape Verde held on through 10 added minutes to secure their win.
Mauritania's Souleymane Anne missed a great chance just before the hour mark.
Mendes came close to scoring with a header from a corner that was well saved by Mauritania goalkeeper Babacar Niasse.
Cape Verde was awarded a penalty when substitute Gilson Tavares Benchimol was brought down in the box by Niasse.
Post-Match Reflections: Cape Verde coach Pedro 'Bubista' Brito expressed pride in his team's performance and their objective to reach the semi-finals.
Mauritania coach Amir Abdou reflected on their loss and expressed hope for future success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cape Verde will face either Morocco or South Africa in the quarter-finals.
Mauritania had hoped to extend their run after winning an AFCON match for the first time in nine attempts in their last group game.
